availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Frank Conway (Nicholas County, Kentucky, merchant and hotel keeper.)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, merchant and hotel keeper. Nicholas County, Kentucky, native. Married to Anne V. Johnson Conway in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on September 20, 1859. Father of Fanny Conway, John W. Conway, and Robert Conway. Merchant in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860. Hotel keeper in Nicholas County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p.143B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Claysville, p. 132A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Nicholas County, KY, July 1863, p. 7.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994051, Nicholas County Marriages, p. 263.
